page.title: 12SCHOOLING IN MURTON
page.content: The earliest recorded school in Murton was the coal company school in 1840 and compeised one classroom. In 1985 there are three primary schools and one nursery in the village. Children of secondary age are educated at Easington comprehensive school,to witch they travel by coach. {SEA VIEW NUSERY SCHOOL. Was built in 1977 as an infant school. Since 1983 it has been a nursery school with sixty children 3 and 4year olds on the roll. {MURTON COUNTY JUNIOR MIXED AND INFANTS {SCHOOL. Was built in 1902 and is a two story building with 300 children mostly from Wembley, and Dalten-le-Dale,and the east of the village. {MURTON JUBILEE JUNIOR MIXED AND {INFANTS SCHOOL. }
